boardgame.name: Skrull: The Barbarian
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Skrull: The Barbarian is an action adventure game developed by 16/32 Diffusion about a warrior that lives in the world of Darkness but tries to free the light.

boardgame.name: Lots
boardgame.description:
After being dealt a a hand of 13, the active player turns up 1, 2 or 3 cards from the talon to form an “auction lot”. Players bid using cards from their hand, playing a number of cards equal to the lot, alternating, one card at a time–where a diamond=0, spades=1, hearts=2 and clubs=3. The winner with the largest total sum of suit-pts takes the lot cards into their hand, the loser gets the unknown consolation lot. The cards used for bidding are swept aside as discards. And so on, as hands get gradually shaped and replaced; essentially the cards won replace the card bid. After the stock is gone, players score for the sum of the ranks of the 13 cards in their final hand (Queens, Jokers=0, Ace-10 equal rank, Jack=11, and Kings=15). Players also earn 20 pts for having five or more cards in a suit, giving an alternative path to victory.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dictopia: 1984
boardgame.description: The 1984 extension is exclusive to Ulule. This extension can only be purchased in pre-order and will never be re-edited thereafter. It contains 20 additional Resistance cards (including 1 for the rules) that you can put in your basic box. These cards are more thematic and echo George Orwell's cult novel 1984.

boardgame.name: Alien Frontiers: Pink Player Color
boardgame.description: Contains 8 colony domes, 6 D6 dice, and 1 scoring rocket in pink. Available from the Alien Frontiers: Factions Definitive Edition Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Alien Frontiers: Purple Player Color
boardgame.description: Contains 8 colony domes, 6 D6 dice, and 1 scoring rocket in purple. Available from the Alien Frontiers: Factions Definitive Edition Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Alien Frontiers: Brown Player Color
boardgame.description: Contains 8 colony domes, 6 D6 dice, and 1 scoring rocket in brown. Available from the Alien Frontiers: Factions Definitive Edition Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Alien Frontiers: Orange Player Color
boardgame.description: Contains 8 colony domes, 6 D6 dice, and 1 scoring rocket in orange. Available from the Alien Frontiers: Factions Definitive Edition Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Alien Frontiers: Grey Player Color
boardgame.description: Contains 8 colony domes, 6 D6 dice, and 1 scoring rocket in grey. Available from the Alien Frontiers: Factions Definitive Edition Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: The Teapot
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

THE TEAPOT is a solo journaling TeaTRPG using the Lost & Found system.

In it, you will set out on the journey of an Awakened Teapot, a sentient teapot with the ability to distill the latent magical properties of various teas into powerful concoctions. However, you are just a simple Teapot and will be handled by a cast of Tea Infusers, magically gift individuals who work together with you to bring out the best in tea service.

Over the years you pass between different Infusers and see the world of humanity change around you, helping the small as well as the mighty with their plights. Passing through the various Tea Eras, you will see budding Infusers make their way in a bright-eyed world during the Freshly Brewed era; flourish alongside your established and well-respected Infusers in the A Tea, Well Steeped era; and finally find yourself among the fallen, the rough, and the tired in the reflective Tea Leaves era.

What will your tea leaves look like at the end of the journey? What fond memories will be etched into your clay? What pain did you ease? Pour yourself a cup of tea and find out!

"May our tea never go cold and let us share in its warmth."

boardgame.name: Companies
boardgame.description:
Companies is carefully designed with fun rules and tactics which allow for multiple playing styles. Inspired by strategy games like Chess and War Games, Companies has elements of exploration, resource gathering, construction, and destruction.

The rules are short and simple. However, the game can become more complex as it goes, providing a unique experience while playing. Companies is packed with dozens of cards ranging from characters to technologies to planetary events. The cards have special abilities, which, with a little luck, can turn the tide against your opponents.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lost Post
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Lost Post is a Lost and Found story game for one player.

Play as a letter adrift in the postal system. An unopened letter is filled with possibilities, and its contents are unfinished and changeable until it is opened by its intended reader. Decide who wrote you and who you were written for, and fill out your pages over the course of the game.

Choose your Carriers, learn their names and personalities, and create stories as you travel around the world. How will you be remembered once you finally finish your journey?

To send a letter is a good way to go somewhere without moving anything but your heart

- Phyllis Theroux

boardgame.name: Stranger Things Adventures Together
boardgame.description:
It is a cooperative game in which you have to try to solve mysteries and defeat monsters. Each turn you have to choose where you move your character and acquire resource or combat enemies.

—user summary


The compelling series Stranger Things has just become an exciting cooperative card game! Will Mike, Dustin, Will and their chums manage to defeat the monsters from the Upside Down?
Players can take on the roles of the famous characters from the series and team up to free Hawkins from the monsters of the Upside Down, revisiting scenes, places and enemies from the Netflix saga.
Each player has their own individual talents, but everyone is united in a shared mission - to unravel the mystery surrounding Eleven and to release Hawkins from the evil presence that grips it.
The game includes: character cards, monster cards, place cards for both the Upside Down and Hawkins, and special place cards for each season of the series.
There are also Eleven cards for averting danger and instrument cards for special powers as well as mystery cards!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Xenomorph
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A highly aggressive endoparasitoid extraterrestrial species. The Xenomorphs are vicious predatory creatures with no higher goals than the propagation of their species and the destruction of any life that could pose a threat to them.

boardgame.name: The Sunken Temple of the Amphibian God
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

An ancient sunken temple at the bottom of a lake, a haunting cult and a sleeping god softly whispering.

The Sunken Temple of the Amphibian God is a system-neutral dungeon designed to be played with any fantasy, OSR, or FKR game.

Contents: Crazed cultists, frog-men, giant eels, hallucinogenic powders, ancient nobles, and an orb to ponder.

boardgame.name: Luggy's Tome of Memory Magic
boardgame.description:
Take a trip down memory lane with this Mementomancy compendium for DND 5E!

Luggy, the mistress of memory, was a dopey enchantress as well as the personification of forgetfulness and repression. Bards, wizards, and warlocks who study her (mostly illegal) work on Mementomancy may seek to manipulate the minds of their enemies or to heal the traumatic pasts of their friends. Their spellbooks may consist of the spells listed here along with others such as the comical Gift of Gab or the legendary Modify Memory.

This product includes:

9 Mementomancy spells for bards, wizards, and warlocks
3 magic items to send your characters on memorable story arcs
For DMs: Lore for a BBEG-tier cult that your players will never forget

boardgame.name: Waves to be as Mountains
boardgame.description:
The Nameless Scriptures predict the End Times, as foretold by the basilisk Verhu. Seven miserable psalms counting down to eternal darkness.
Leviathan has risen from the Endless Sea, fulfilling the prophecy of the fourth psalm. But perhaps you can stop the Apocalypse.
Pound pitons into slimy flesh.
Tie ropes tightly.
Begin your ascent.

A Kaiju-Sized Hex Crawl

Created for KAIJUJAM and inspired by Cloverfield and Pacific Rim, this is an adventure where the monster is the map. Leviathan becomes a hex map where the players start at the bottom and climb to the top. Kaiju movie tropes are built-in, including The Amicable Society for the Deferral of the Apocalypse finding a "weak spot" on Leviathan.

This 14 page third-party Mörk Borg adventure includes:

d8 Rumors & Lies
Leviathan hex map
d12 Random Encounters While Climbing
Three new creatures with stats

boardgame.name: Brass: Birmingham
boardgame.description: Welcome to the Industrial Revolution! Lead your fast-growing business enterprise, build and develop new industries, multiply your income and don’t get distracted by your rivals. Show everyone you are the real deal!

boardgame.name: Wonderland's War: Promo Card Pack
boardgame.description:
A set of five promo cards that was available as optional purchase during the Wonderland's War Pledge Manager in order to help the publisher offset the enormous increase in the freight cost of the project.

These cards include alternate art and new abilities for the following Wonderlandians: Duchess, Gryphon, March Hare, Unicorn, and White Rabbit.

listing.notes:
- Brand new in seal. - Kickstarter Promo pack to assist the shipping cost. - Price in USD.
Final sale, no refunds.
Local pick up available at Richmond Hill, ON Canada.

boardgame.name: Beetle Island
boardgame.description:
It is 1894. A ship carrying you and other explorer-naturalists has landed on the shores of Coleopterra—a newly discovered island in the Pacific Ocean. Untouched by humans, Coleopterra is home to countless undiscovered species, including a marvelous array of strange and mesmerizing beetles.

You have been sent here in the pursuit of science. Search the island for new species of beetles, then use your powers of observation to classify the beetle specimens into groups. The explorer who draws the most meaningful connections will earn the respect of the scientific community and go down in history for their discoveries!

AIM OF THE GAME

Expedition: Beetle Island is a competitive tile-laying game of matching beetles (tiles) based on their traits. Stay focused, place tiles strategically, and score bonuses for large combinations. To win, earn the most points by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Smart 10: Vetenskap
Smart10: Tiede
boardgame.description: 50 new cards with 100 new science related questions. Requires the base game for play.

boardgame.name: Smart10: Gaming
Smart10: Gaming & Gambling
Smart10: Pelaaminen
boardgame.description: 50 new cards and 100 new gaming related questions. Requires base game for play.

boardgame.name: Paso del BrahmÃ¡n
boardgame.description:
Paso del Brahmán is an abstract board game for two players in which each player represents 3 characters, Brahman, Tiger and Cobra.

On each turn, the player must choose a character and perform one or two basic abilities (Walk, Summon) or his special ability (Meditate, Levitate, Bite), with the aim of bringing his Brahman to the opponent's temple or eliminating the rival's. It is a simple game to learn but difficult to master.


Paso del Brahmán es un juego de mesa abstracto para dos jugadores en el que cada jugador representará a 3 personajes: Brahmán, Tigre y Cobra.

En cada turno el jugador deberá elegir un personaje y realizar una o dos habilidades básicas (Caminar, Invocar) o su habilidad especial (Meditar, Levitar, Morder), con el objetivo de llevar su Brahmán al templo del oponente o eliminar al del rival. Un juego simple de aprender pero difícil de dominar.

boardgame.name: I Guess This Is It
boardgame.description:
A two-player game about saying goodbye.

We had such a good run. We were great together. Now we stand in front of each other, just minutes before our last goodbye. There’s so much to say. And so much we know will be left unsaid.

I Guess This Is It is a two-player RPG game about saying goodbye. Players take the role of two people once strongly connected standing before each other in the final minutes before their last goodbye. They will work together to try and say as much as they can before leaving, but being careful not to hurt each other's feelings.

The mechanics aim to emulate the emotions of the moment, in which there's so much you want to say before they go, but you also don't want to make the other person feel guilty or neglected. You know time won't be enough and there will be things left unsaid. How do you make the most of this last instant together?

When no story cards remain, it's time to say goodbye. There's no more time for stories. The person leaving says the words on the Goodbye card, then gets up and leaves. After a short break, get back together. Reveal the cards left on your hands. Those are the things left unsaid. Look at them together one by one, and silently reflect on their meaning, on how you wish you had just a little more time together. If you both had the same amount of cards in your hands, you at least feel you were on the same page, and your final conversation was in sync, like the good old days.

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Potions & Perils Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!

Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins. When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!

Additionally, the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Race To Chimney Rock
boardgame.description:
Go west, young pioneer — your journey begins here! In this first leg of your trek on the Oregon Trail, you need to find your way to Chimney Rock — but not without unpredictable challenges ahead. This is the first installment of four books that will take you all the way to Oregon Territory — if you make the right choices.

In book one of this exciting choose-your-own-trail series, it's 1850 and your first goal is to get your family, covered wagon full of supplies, and oxen to Chimney Rock on time. But hurry — you'll need to make it through the rugged mountains before winter snow hits. Plus, there are wild animals, natural disasters, unpredictable weather, fast-flowing rivers, strangers, and sickness that will be sure to stand between you and your destination!

Which path will get you safely across the prairie? With twenty-two possible endings, choose wrong and you'll never make it to Chimney Rock on time. Choose right and blaze a trail that gets you closer to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: Danger At The Haunted Gate
boardgame.description:
Continue west, young pioneer — the second leg of your journey starts here — and it won't be any easier. Natural disasters, disease, and dishonest people are challenges you'll face in the wild frontier. Now, trek on the Oregon Trail to Devil's Gate! This is the second installment of four books that will take you all the way to Oregon Territory — if you make the right choices.

In book two of this exciting choose-your-own-trail series, it's 1850 and you've been traveling for the past six weeks on foot for fifteen miles a day with your family, covered wagon full of supplies, and oxen. And congratulations — you made it to Chimney Rock. But your journey has just begun. You need to get to Devil's Gate, the halfway mark on your 2,000-mile journey west. Keep watch! Danger awaits on your way to those eerie cliffs.

Which path will you choose in the face of danger? With twenty-two possible endings, choose wrong and you'll never make it to Devil's Gate. Choose right and blaze a trail that gets you closer to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Search For Snake River
boardgame.description:
In the third installment of this choose-your-own-trail adventure series, young pioneers must find — and survive — a wild river crossing!

It’s 1850 and you are on the third leg of your journey across the American frontier. You've crossed prairies, rivers, and mountains and have faced stampeding buffalo. But your journey is not yet over. After travelling for more than two months with your family, covered wagon, and oxen, you're only halfway to Oregon City. There are still months of travel ahead of you — if you can survive the dangerous ford of the wild Snake River at Three Island Crossing!

Every decision counts! Which path will you choose? With twenty-two possible endings, choose wrong and you'll never find Snake River. Choose right and blaze a trail that gets you closer to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Road To Oregon City
boardgame.description:
The end of the Oregon Trail is near, young pioneer — the fourth and final leg of your journey starts here. But, do you have the grit to make it to Oregon City? The wild frontier is full of risks and unpredictable surprises! This is the final installment of four books that will take you all the way to Oregon Territory — if you make the right choices.

In the fourth and final book of this exciting choose-your-own-trail series, it's 1850 and you've traveled for more than three months on foot for fifteen miles a day with your family, covered wagon, and oxen. There are holes in the bottoms of your shoes. You've faced grizzly bears, traded with merchants, and wild bandits. Oregon City is so close—you can taste it. But you still have a ways to go on the Trail. There are still weeks of travel ahead of you — if you can survive the dangerous frontier.

Trust yourself. Which path will you choose? With twenty-two possible endings, every decision counts. Choose wisely and make it all the way to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: Alone In The Wild
boardgame.description:
In this exciting choose-your-own-trail stand-alone experience featuring 8-bit art, it's 1849 and you are at the halfway point on your journey west on the Oregon Trail. When a powerful storm separates you from your family, you must use all of your smarts to survive on your own. Along the way, you meet a twelve-year-old girl from the Shoshone Nation, who has the grit and smarts to help you both make it to Oregon Territory.

Which path will get you safely across the country and reunited with your family?

With twenty-two possible endings, choose wrong and you'll never live out your dreams. Choose right and blaze a trail that gets you to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Oregon Trail 6: The Wagon Train Trek
boardgame.description:
Keep your wagon train alive in this trailblazing choose-your-own-trail experience on the Oregon Trail! With more than twenty possible endings, there are wild animals, rapid rivers, bandits, treacherous weather, famine, and even death that stand between you and your dream life out West. Do you have what it takes to make it all the way to Oregon City?

In this exciting choose-your-own-trail stand-alone story featuring 8-bit art, it's 1850 and you are leading a whole covered wagon train with your family on a 2,000-mile trek on the Oregon Trail. Wild animals, natural disasters, unpredictable weather, famine, fast-flowing rivers, strangers, and sickness stand in between you and your destination: Oregon City! Do you have the smarts and skills to keep everyone safe and together on the Trail?

Which path will get you safely across the country?

With twenty-three possible endings, choose wrong and you'll never live out your dreams. Choose right and blaze a trail that gets you closer to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: Gold Rush!
boardgame.description:
You’re in the middle of the Gold Rush, pioneer — and you are headed west on the Oregon Trail with hopes to strike it rich in this choose-your-own-trail experience. Travel in your large wagon train and decide whether you’ll stay the course to Oregon or take the California Trail toward Sacramento. Do your choices lead to a fortune-filled future, or will they lead you straight into danger? Westward ho!

It's 1851. You and your family are on a two-thousand-mile journey of a lifetime on the Oregon-California Trail. Along with thousands of other pioneers, you're headed west, hoping to strike it rich int he middle of the Gold Rush. But your gold fever and excitement will only get you so far. Be prepared! Many obstacles lie ahead, and you will have to depend on your wagon train to survive. You'll face dangers such as dehydration, sickness, ruthless bandits, starvation, and flash floods. Persevere, pioneer! It will take all of your skills and smarts to get to your final destination.

Trust yourself. Which path will you choose? With more than twenty possible endings, every decision matters. Choose wisely and make it all the way to your dream life out West!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: 1453 Istanbul 'un Fethi
boardgame.description: Semi-cooperative game about the Fall of Constantinople 1453. Up to 5 players may play as a Commander of the Ottoman forces. The Byzantines are represented by cards which are played by the Commanders to negate the strengths of the opposing Commanders. Byzantium must fall within 20 turns or the Ottomans will lose; the winning Commander is the Commander with the most fronts conquered when Byzantium Falls.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Classical Age of the Ottoman Empire

boardgame.name: Calamity In The Cold
boardgame.description:
In this choose-your-own-trail experience, you’re traveling all the way from Florida, heading west to the Oregon Trail. See if you can make it to Oregon City!

It’s 1845 and your family is fleeing Florida with hopes of starting fresh out west. You’ll encounter sudden snowstorms that will overwhelm your wagon train en route to the Oregon Trail. Food will become scarce — and you’ll get lost. Can you survive the unseasonably cold climates? If you make the right choices, you could find the Lewis and Clark Trail, which would lead back to the Oregon Trail — though it will take longer than you’d planned. Do you have the supplies to last? Can you survive the unseasonably cold weather, pioneer?

Trust yourself. Which path will you choose? With more than twenty possible endings, every decision matters. Choose right and blaze a trail to Oregon City!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The 5th Key
boardgame.description:
The 5th Key is a medieval turn-based strategy game where the goal is to obtain five or more keys and gain control on the central island. During the game you can use special cards which will give you strategic advantages and are designed to make the game fun and balanced.

After each round the control of the Castle port changes from one player to the next in clockwise order. A player can use the Explorer Spirit card to obtain the control of the port for the next 2 rounds,. The first player to obtain 5 keys and gain control on the castle port on his turn wins the game.

Battles are the only way to obtain keys. Every player starts with 3 keys and the remaining 2 keys need to be obtained from the neighbour players, the battle mechanics are based on a simple formula: dice points multiplied by the attack points plus the number of soldiers, during the match you can send a maximum of 20 soldiers for a battle and by default the number of attack points is 1, but it can be increased with the Brave Destiny Card. You can only launch an attack at your turn after collecting your village resources, If you win the battle you can claim 1 key and 5 coins if available. The loosing party will loose the number of soldiers sent to the battle unless he has hospitals to treat his soldiers.

After each battle the losing party will be allowed to draw a special card, the card needs to be displayed at any time to others, some cards are valid only once and need to be returned to the card pool, other cards are held permanently by the player. Only the defender can claim the special card and only the attacker can claim the key and the coins.

boardgame.name: Host Your Own Escape Room
boardgame.description:
Are you ready to embark on a code-cracking challenge? You and your guests have been invited to an exclusive launch party at the London art gallery Grafix. As you admire the artwork, the lights suddenly go off and you find yourself mysteriously trapped inside with no way out. One of the galleries most celebrated artists has been taken hostage and you have just 60 minutes to identify their location and rescue them before it's too late. Ideal for escape room novices, the difficulty level of this escape room game is moderate. Great for families or groups of friends looking for a fun evening of entertainment- no knowledge of London needed!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Logix
boardgame.description:
A spatial board game in which each player draws his secret code, the pattern of which must be composed of colored balls on a spatial board. The winner is the one who predicts the movements of the opponents, thwarts their plans and forms the first code.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Der kleine Sprechdachs
boardgame.description:
NOTE: not to be confused with Der kleine Sprechdachs, designed by Reiner Knizia[/boardgamedesigner].

The game is about describing these titular friends instead of making up and remembering stories as in the Knizia game.

boardgame.name: La Garde avance!
boardgame.description:
La Garde avance ! is an original module for the Jours de Gloire series, set at battalion scale, inserted ine VaeVictis magazine #161.

It covers the last attack of the French army during the Battle of Waterloo. Napoleon’s last reserve, six battalions of the Middle Guard and five battalions of the Old Guard, set off in square formation to assault Wellington’s thin red line that was still holding its positions, while Blücher’s forces were becoming an ever greater threat on the French army’s right flank.

The scale is 100 m per hexagon and one Strength Point corresponds to about 200 infantry, 150 cavalry or 2 guns. The historical scenario has 5 turns, each covering twenty minutes of real time. A game of La Garde avance! should last around 1 hour.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Code Kakuro
boardgame.description:
Each player receives 2 score counters of one color and places them on the game board. Place the hourglass next to the game board. Choose any kakuro and place it in the magic board. The rules of the game: Each player now has 1 minute, clockwise, to place numbers on the board. The time is measured by the hourglass. Players receive points as follows:

1 point for each correct number
3 points for each number that completes a group


Example: If a player places 2 numbers correctly on the board and another number that completes a group, he receives 5 points for it (2 points for the 2 numbers and 3 points for the number that completed the group).

The bonus points are awarded only if the player can complete a full group within his minute (there are no bonus points for completing a group already partially placed by other players).

If a player places a number incorrectly, his turn ends immediately. In addition, the wrong number is removed from the board again. The player who notices a wrongly placed number receives the number of points for a correctly placed number. The game ends when the Kakuro is completely solved. The player with the highest score wins the game.

_________________

One year earlier in 2005 JUMBO started the mini-series of 'Japanese Cult Riddle Games' with Code Sudoku.

boardgame.name: Imaginarium Dobro

boardgame.description:
Before you is not quite a classic "Imaginarium". Each card in the "Kind" deck is the fruit of the joint creativity of a child and a professional illustrator. The children — pupils of orphanages and patients of hospices — put all their unbridled imagination into sketches, which were then worked on by the best Russian artists, trying to bring the clarity of lines and images to perfection, while retaining the idea and mood of a child’s drawing. This is a world of children's fantasy without limits and restrictions. And most importantly, these are stories that children can tell us. In the box you will find a brochure with original drawings and the names of their authors.

You can play Imaginarium Dobro even with preschoolers: the illustrations here are bright, and the images are understandable.
Finally, another feature of the game is that we created it together with the Civic Chamber of the Russian Federation and the charitable foundations "LIVE", "Ship", "House of Ronald McDonald", "Vera", "Sheredar", "Nastenka", "Creation" , "Rusfond". 100 rubles from the sale of each box of "Imaginarium Dobro" are transferred to these organizations to help children.

Want to see what cards are in the deck? You are welcome!

The updated version of the Imaginarium Dobro has a convenient plastic lodgement with storerooms for decks and a special closable compartment for chips. We've made the board removable and added scoring tips to make the game even more enjoyable. Also in the new version, numerators appeared - special tokens that help put the cards in order and make it easier to vote. Winged elephants, however, remained the same: bright, cheerful and transparent, like candy.

boardgame.name: Chaotic Scrolls
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

D10 new scrolls for Mörk Borg.

"Chaotic Scrolls" is part of "Den of Disarray", a randomly generated dungeon for Mörk Borg, which will be released soon.

boardgame.name: Great Boy The Game
boardgame.description:
Great Boy the Game is a 1-3 player narrative puzzle that gives the players a chance to work out a mysterious miracle story about Elijah from the bible.
Players will have to:


Explore locations
Find items including clues, spiritual weapons, non-playable characters, tradeable goods, and scriptures key to solving the puzzles
maintain their strength and confidence stats
make really difficult choices that alter the course of the game
fight spiritual battles

boardgame.name: Lair of the Mutant
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A mysterious threat resides within the ancient ruins of an old noble's house from the times of the empire and a local farming family is at risk when they are found to have disappeared from their homestead.

Can your party of adventurers uncover details of the threat and rescue the family?

Lair of the Mutant is a starter adventure designed for the Heroes of Adventure role-playing game system and is designed for a party of 1st level heroes.

This adventure is semi-compatible with other fantasy roleplaying games and can be adapted for use with other game systems.

This adventure was released as part of Zine Month (ZIMO) 2022 in Feb 2022.

boardgame.name: Secret Agenda
boardgame.description:
Magic has become unbalanced, creating disharmony among the citizens of the realm, and prompting an investigation by the order of Zoological Zealots. They have ruled that casting communities in your area were illegally gerrymandered and new ley lines must be cast immediately. As an adept and member of the magic community, you have been summoned to join the sacred council recasting the lines. This is your opportunity to alter the lines to benefit your own secret agenda. Rezone the new communities to your liking, but be careful! The other communities have their secret agendas as well. You'll have to outmaneuver the rest of the sacred council to benefit your community.

The sacred council is now called to order.

This is a family friendly game for players 12 and up. Bring this game home or easily take it with you to a party or game night. These premium custom components will look great in your hand and in play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crisis Collection 1
boardgame.description:
Team up to save the DC Universe! Crisis Collection 1 brings together the first two Crisis Expansion Packs for the DC Deck-Building Game series and offers a wide variety of new cards to add to any base game. Get ready to face some of the most epic challenges in comic book history with the introduction of Crisis events and Impossible Mode Super-Villains. But this time you won’t be going it alone, thanks to cooperative gameplay that lets you team up to win… and survive!

Crisis Expansion Pack 1 and 2 reimagine the eight Super Heroes from the original DC Deck-Building Game and the eight from Heroes Unite with Crisis versions for cooperative play. In addition, the Super-Villains from those games—and some new ones—have been upgraded to Impossible Mode, making them much more difficult to defeat. There are even six new oversized Super Heroes in each expansion to go along with all the new main deck cards!

This is not a standalone product. Requires any DC Deck-Building Game base game to play.

Key Features

Includes Crisis Expansion Pack 1 and 2
Adds cooperative gameplay mode with Crisis cards that require players to work together to overcome
FOIL oversized Super Hero cards
Impossible Mode Super-Villains that add new challenges to cooperative and competitive modes
White Lantern Sinestro oversized FOIL Promo Card in every box
Red Lantern Spectre Promo Card (free with early orders, while supplies last)
—description from the publisher

Contents Summary

2 Crisis Expansion Packs
121 Game Cards
28 Oversized Super Hero Cards (FOIL)
2 Rulebooks
1 White Lantern Sinestro Oversized Crisis Super Hero Promo Card (FOIL)

DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Crisis Expansion Pack 2
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil
DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Heroes Unite
DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Teen Titans
DC Deck-Building Game: Dark Nights â Metal

boardgame.name: ãã¨ããã¤ã (Otogiatsume)
boardgame.description:
The Black Hood has scattered all of the fairy tale characters! It's your job to gather them back together.

In this simple but engaging game, players try to complete sets of characters from famous stories, including Little Red Riding Hood, Alice in Wonderland, Urashima and the Kingdom Beneath the Sea, and Journey to the West.

Each player begins with a hand of four cards, and there is a face-down deck with two face-up cards on each side. On their turn, a player must discard a card to one of the face-up piles. They then draw from either the face-down deck or the other face-up pile.

The goal is to complete one of the four-character story sets or two of the two-character story sets. The first to complete such a set wins. To add to the fun, each character is only on one card but may appear in multiple stories, and the Black Hood card acts as a wild. Advanced rules, where you must play until winning twice in a row, are also available.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Little Red Riding Hood
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Tortoise and the Hare
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Little Pigs

boardgame.name: Peco Peco
boardgame.description:
The players seek to assemble different Foods in order to present the best buffet.

The game is played in several round, continuing until no one has played a card after everyone at the table has had a turn.
Each player, during their turn can play 1 Animal card from their hand if it beats the one at the top of the discard pile.
There are 3 types of cards:
- The Cat must be played over/beats the Mouse
- The Mouse must be played over/beats the Elephant
- The Elephant must be played over/beats the Cat

The player is also allowed to pass even though a playable card is in the hand, it is called bluffing.

At the beginning of the next turn, the player can accuse the previous player to have bluffed.
If the accuser is right, the accuser take 1 Animal card from the bluffer's hand, if the accuser is wrong, the accused player can take a card in the accuser's hand.

The last player to have played 1 Animal card wins that round and the prize (1 Food card).

The game proceeds until one player gather 1 Food card of each type: Maki, Sushi and Onigiri.

boardgame.name: Neverwinter - Fury of the Feywild
Neverwinter: Fury of the Feywild
boardgame.description:
the expansion added a new campaign, adventure zone, skirmish, and a new dungeon, along with numerous other updates.

Prepare your adventure party to enter deep within Neverwinter Wood into the new zone of Sharandar. What awaits you? The fomorian king, Malabog, and his forces along with the ever-increasing threat of Valindra Shadowmantle and her dangerous influence. You must also face the formidable Red Caps and other iconic Dungeons & Dragons creatures to keep the elves of Iliyanbruen safe.

boardgame.name: Neverwinter - Sharandar
Neverwinter: Sharandar
boardgame.description: In Neverwinter: Sharandar, an unsettling darkness creeps across the Feywild and the age-old elven stronghold of Sharandar. Brutish creatures kill any foolish enough to enter the lands once held by Malabog the Fomorian King. Deep in the forest, rumors of an ancient fey being, together with scattered bands of Malabog’s minions, seek to conquer Sharandar and seize its arcane secrets.

boardgame.name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crossover Collection 1
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your DC Deck-Building Game Experience! Crossover Collection 1 brings together three classic Crossover Packs in one package. Each expansion lets you play as new Super Heroes or Super-Villains, adds new game cards, and introduces innovative mechanics to any base game in the DC Deck-Building Game series.

Key Features
Three Crossover Pack expansions: The Rogues, Birds of Prey, and New Gods
New game mechanics: Teamwork, card rotation, Homeworlds
Black Racer Promo Card in every box
Limited edition Reverse-Flash Promo Card free with early orders.
Foil oversized Character cards

In Crossover Pack 5: The Rogues, you become a Super-Villain who always has some help within reach, thanks to “Teamwork.” This keyword found on many of the cards allows you to play the top card of another player’s deck. The code “honor among thieves” usually applies here, as the player who assists you gets a piece of the action.

In Crossover Pack 6: Birds of Prey, you can play as the preeminent all-female covert ops team founded by Black Canary and Oracle. A brand-new innovation in this expansion is card rotation. Many effects on the cards, including the Super Heroes, allow players to rotate their cards and earn bonuses.

In Crossover Pack 7: The New Gods, you can play as Super Heroes living on New Genesis or Super-Villains residing on Apokolips. There are two stacks of HOMEWORLD cards, each with a special ability that all players can take advantage of. If you are Darkseid, you seek to conquer New Genesis … but so do your fellow Super-Villain players. The Super Heroes, conversely, compete to conquer Apokolips.

This is not a standalone product. Requires any DC Deck-Building Game base game to play.

boardgame.name: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel! â Shock Drop Slaughter Pit
boardgame.description: An arena-based DLC for Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel, originally included as the pre-order bonus. Now it is sold separately or included in the handsome collection or legendary collection of the Borderlands series as well. - written by Bowman21

boardgame.name: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel! - Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrade Pack: The Holodome Onslaught
boardgame.description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter pack increases the level cap by 10 and the Holodome Onslaughter adds a new side mission that is a challenge arena. - written by Bowman 21

boardgame.name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms â Resource Tracker Boards
boardgame.description:
Description from the publisher:

A key change from VCK 1st Edition and 2nd Edition was changing from a couple-hundred wood resource tokens to punchboard resource tracker boards. This change allowed us to reduce the retail price of VCK 2nd Edition so that more gamers would be encouraged to give it a try.

If you have VCK 1st Edition and want to use this resource tracker board system, this pack will get you going. You can use the wood tokens from your VCK1E as marker tokens or use the punchboard tokens provided here.

Please be aware that the VCK 1st Edition game box does not have storage space for these boards, so you might also want to upgrade to the Bigger Storage Box which does have a dedicated storage location for the tracking boards.

boardgame.name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings â 2022 Edition
boardgame.description:
This supplement for Kings of War introduces two whole new armies to the game, the Halflings and the Riftforged Orcs.

As well as all the background and lists for these two new factions. there's a narrative campaign with new scenarios and the annual Clash of Kings game update. This supplement has big changes to magic, new items, and spells, and new and changed units for every army. Formations are back too for every list, and there is a slew of new heroes.

boardgame.name: Hoa
boardgame.description:
Hoa is a beautiful puzzle-platforming game that features breathtaking hand-painted art, lovely music, and a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere. Experience the magic of nature and imagination as you play the main character, Hoa, on her journey through breathtaking environments back to where it all began.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Takeshi and Hiroshi
boardgame.description:
"Takeshi and Hiroshi" combines the two worlds of puppet animation and Role Playing Game. It tells the story of two brothers and their daily life. The 14-year-old Takeshi, a game designer to-be, is creating a game for his weak little brother Hiroshi who always wants to play the next chapter of the game as soon as possible. As the game is still in the making, Takeshi has to improvise and secretly plays some of the monster roles himself. It is Takeshi's goal to make Hiroshi really enjoy his game, let him meet big challenges, but preferably to prevent him from losing. He has to choose which monsters shall appear when and struggles more and more as the challenge for him as a game creator becomes increasingly difficult.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Agent Intercept
boardgame.description:
The world needs you, Agent! Take control of the Sceptre, the Agency’s latest high-tech transforming vehicle, and face off against the criminal organisation CLAW in this explosive arcade driving game.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Last Full Measure: The Maryland Campaign
boardgame.description:
Lee's 1862 invasion of Maryland from South Mountain and Harper's Ferry to the Battle of Antietam at 300 yards per hex, 100 men per strength point, regiments, artillery batteries, in 944 counters and a 43 x 55 inch map.
The files for Last Full Measure titles are free to download, print, and play.

boardgame.name: M.A.D. Bots
boardgame.description:
Inspired by modern, real world, robot combat, M.A.D.Bots takes the idea of pitting two custom built robots against one another in a contest of speed, force, and luck.

Using cards, players choose their drive system, weapon system, and level of defense to create their robot. Then they roll to enhance the natural levels of those parts. Taking as many turns as it takes, each turn a combination of the strategy of your build and the luck of the dice to move faster, attack harder, and destroy your opponent.

boardgame.name: Where Else Can She Be? The Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
This expansion pack for the award-winning adventure CCC-NBDD01-02: Where Can She Be? adds Baldur's Gate, Parnast, Phandalin, Port Nyanzaru, Saltmarsh, and Waterdeep to the available locations for players to visit during the adventure, as well as 18 new henchmen, lots of puns, at least three fish, and a never-before-seen police sketch of the notorious thief Carmille Santiago!

—Publisher blurb

boardgame.name: Kitten Box
í¤í¼ë°ì¤
boardgame.description:
Roll and organize the scattered boxes faster than anyone else so the kitten can go in, then you'll earn the title as "the best personal cat servant!"

Kitten Box is a puzzle game for 1 to 6 player which requires players their spatial perception and sequential thinking to solve the problem.

First, you open a challenge card and place two boxes and the kitten figure on their starting position. Then, everyone rushes to find the way to organize two boxes in one (by rolling the smaller one into the bigger one) and then bring them in front of the kitten. (So, the kitten may jump in and make itself cozy!)

Players CANNOT physically touch the boxes when they do this, but they may use their personal drawing board to mark their plan how they will roll the boxes.

Once it's done, players will take turn proving their solution from who claimed the shortest way. Whoever gets it right, takes the challenge card. When a player collects certain number of cards depend on the number of player, wins the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

boardgame.name: Lunar Rush
boardgame.description:
Lunar Rush is a simultaneous-play Euro-style board game that combines multiple mechanics into a refreshing new genre. You play as one of Earth’s four major conglomerates, competing to mine the Moon for the newly-discovered lunethyst crystals and lunarium ore.

Companies bid to transport resources to and from the Moon via the most efficient route possible; build and upgrade their Moon bases to mine and refine lunethyst and lunarium; sell the finished product on Earth to maximize profits.

Every turn, players use their VPs to bid for the best space routes to and from the Moon. The slower the route, the more you can take on the ship. Then on the Moon, players simultaneously upgrade their bases and place workers to produce the resources they need to ship back to Earth's bustling luxury markets. Finally, they sell all their Moon goods on Earth to profit!

The game ends after a fixed number of turns, and the winner is the player with the most VP (from selling goods and building the best Moon base and wonders)!

The race to win the new gold rush is on!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shades of Ink
boardgame.description:
After coming into possession of a stack of old psychological inkblot tests, you discover that the accompanying notes hint at something unnerving - they imply that the ink has power and that the blots hold trapped spirits that feed, somehow, on the viewer's psychic energy...

Shades of Ink is a solo role playing game where you will look at inkblots, note what you see, and then fight to destroy the shades that manifest from your visions. As you accumulate knowledge, the spirits' power also accumulates until it coalesces to form one final encounter.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Defending Ruins: Pavlov's house
boardgame.description:
Get the game at wargame vault:https://www.wargamevault.com/product/386322/Defending-Ruins-Pavlovs-house?fbclid=IwAR2TX18VDh3WD2Txc1Zn8ZwAexKyW3EfM0YUggDlRrqdjCJFSuowYVDZKAY

This is a single player Roll And Write mechanics game with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

The German invasion of Stalingrad absorbed a great deal of military and human material for the defense of this city stationed on the Volga, defense is vital and it will be fought in any corner. Pavlov´s house or the lighthouse is an important point on the of January 9 square, if you miss this point you will probably miss a large part of the city. Defend her to the death.

boardgame.name: Impel City
boardgame.description:
Find out about the possibilities of the Impel Group. Meet ImpelCity, a city where the services and products of the Impel Group help to live comfortably and safely every day. It is a city that is not on the map, but you can easily find it in Impel's comprehensive business offer.

On their turn, a player picks a card then he/she choose section for resources and performs certain actions.

The game ends when the last card is chosen. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Shadowverse Evolve
boardgame.description:
The offline version of famous Japanese online collectible card game Shadowverse.
Each player plays a hero who has 20 life points and use minions to fight the opponent. The minions can evolve and attack the opponent, the player who makes the opponent's life point to 0 will win the game.

boardgame.name: Build Divide
boardgame.description:
Aniplex's first trading card game, released in sync with the TV anime of the same name.
In this game, players construct a deck with 40-50 cards and use it to fight with the opponent. Players use character cards to fight, if a character card give the opponent a directly attack, the opponent will lose one life card, the player who makes the opponent's life card to zero will win the game.

boardgame.name: Millennia
boardgame.description:
Millennia is a competitive civilization game for 1-4 players.

The game's setting spans several millennia, namely a time span of thousands of years. Players go through eight ages from the ancient, to medieval ages, to the modern age and finally to the near future and the player with most victory points wins. The game features game board and more than 300 cards, with more than 200 unique card illustrations with motifs from different ages.

Each age has several phases. The four most important phases are:

+ Tech phase: In this phase 14 new technology cards from that age are revealed. Players take turns to draft those technology cards.

+ Building Phase: In this phase players take turns to buy newly revealed buildings and wonders from that age.

+ Action phase: In this phase players use their tech cards and buildings to perform actions on the game board. Used cards are rotated by 90 degrees. The action phase can be done by all players simultaneously.

+ Military Phase: The players reduce their position on the military track by the equal number of steps required to make the lowest positioned player land on 0. Then players score their position minus 1 victory point per defeat.

Tech and building cards have an age duration: it indicates during which ages the respective card is active. At the end of an age, players discard all their tech cards that become obsolete and flip their building cards that become obsolete (players keep them for some scoring purposes). This mechanic allows to change your strategic focus in different phases of the game: For example you can concentrate on military in the early-game and later focus on research when your military cards have become obsolete anyway.

After 8 ages the player with most victory points is crowned the winner!

boardgame.name: Library Labyrinth
boardgame.description:
Build a team of amazing fictional and historical women to put escaped literary terrors back in their books! Can the Lady of Shalott defeat Dracula? Or Heidi and Ada Lovelace overcome a Kraken? Can Nzinga and Mary Seacole deal with the Martian Robots from War of the Worlds?

Library Labyrinth is a co-operative board game set in a cursed library that plays in about 45-60 minutes for 2-5 players and around 30 minutes as a solo game. The play space is a grid of 25 octagonal tiles that can rotate and flip, revealing (and changing) parts of the library. Some tiles spawn literary terrors, which players need to defeat by drafting different book cards from their hands. These book cards each feature a fictional or historical woman with a combination of six different skills. Team up different cards to defeat specific terrors, then travel through the library to place the terrors back on the correct shelves. The curse is still at work in the library, however, undoing your good work, so make sure that you don't run out of time or let the library become overwhelmed...

In more detail, on your turn you can pick up cards, trade cards, flip or rotate floor tiles, move down a lit path (as shown on the floor tiles), capture a terror, or put a terror back in the right shelf. You have three actions available with the option to donate one action to another player. After each player turn, a curse disturbance card is drawn, which disrupts the playing area by rotating a tile or spawning a new terror. When all six shelves have been filled with a captured terror, you win; if the deck of curse cards runs out or six terrors are left on the library floor before this happens, the game is lost.

Library Labyrinth is a quick game leading to ridiculous character mash-ups. Of course Alice in Wonderland and Marie Curie can deal with the Big Bad Wolf! The game can also scale between a game suitable for ten-year-olds and a fiendish puzzle. Floor tiles can be swapped out to make a harder grid, more difficult monsters can be used, or the amount of time can be reduced. Each game also comes with a booklet about the characters and the literary terrors in the game.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 35: Iberian Gauge, Blinks, and an Interview with Jessica Metheringham of Dissent Games

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #24)
boardgame.description:
From website:

Welcome to the second anniversary of The Glatisant! Two years ago, I did not expect this to become one of the biggest RPG newsletter out there, so thank you all for the support!

Knave 2e
Reviews
News
Sales
Awards and Retrospectives
Theory and Advice
Rules and Game Design
Art
Worldbuilding
History
Podcasts and Interviews

boardgame.name: MÃ©crÃ©ants
boardgame.description:
A standard medieval and fantasy miniature fighting game for 2 players.
The goal is to defeat the army of your opponent (by killing all his/her miniatures) using dice rolls and miniatures' stats
You use 1d10, a measuring tape, miniatures, each miniature must be attached to a square base.
Each miniature is costing a number of points based on what it represents, what it is wearing and its weapons.
Both players agree on an army budget.
A game is divided in turn, a turn is divided : 1st player range attack, 2nd player range attack, 1st movement and combat, 2nd movement and combar, combats resolution, 1st player range attack, 2nd player range attack

boardgame.name: MÃ©crÃ©ants: Extension numÃ©ro 1
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds:

rules clarifications
new obstacles (ditches, frieze horses, trap doors, etc.)
new environments (quick-sand, volcanoes, etc.)
new creatures (dragons, hydras and chimeras)

boardgame.name: The Great Gift Giver
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Great Gift Giver is a silly, enjoyable Christmas one-shot surrounding the tense relationship between Kris Klaws and his son, Beffrey Jezos. Help Klaws reclaim Christmas and be the Great Gift Giver once again! The Great Gift Giver is a 4–5-hour adventure for a party of 4-6 players at level 5.

boardgame.name: Relic of the Lost Kingdom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Relic of the Lost Kingdom is aimed at brand new GMs and players and is a 3–4-hour adventure for a party of 4-5 1st level characters. The scenario is set in a lightly-populated area and designed to be transplantable into most other settings.

In this adventure, the characters are tasked with protecting a local monastery from a nightly horde of undead. A group of adventurers had previously taken a relic from a nearby tomb and have accidentaly unleashed the undead within.

boardgame.name: Inn of the Buxom Wench (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Inn of the Buxom Wench V2 is a useful setting and maps for any fantasy RPG. Though it has stats for 5th edition it can truly be issued with any rules setting.

This edition contains:

Both 2D and 3D maps
Player handouts
Details on the NPCs at the Inn
Plot hooks and ideas for adventures related to the Inn
Title History:

The Inn of the Buxom Wench originally began as a part of the Halls of Runehammer adventure. It was later expanded to be a stand alone location setting.
During the 2021 Kickstarter for Hope Not Lost the Inn of the Buxom Wench was further expanded as a 2nd Version with additional artwork, NPCs, and encounters. A standalone menu you can handout to the players was also added.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: A Hole In The Ground Terrain & Games

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 18)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is issue No. 18 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures. The only exception is a three-chapter adventure named The Fabled Vault which we have featured at the end of the magazine.

The modules are written with the 5th ed. OGL in mind but rules are often left to a minimum. Most adventures are appropriate for low to mid-level (Levels 1 to 10) adventur­ing parties. We include a note at the beginning of each adventure with a ballpark estimation of party level and playing time.

boardgame.name: The Saboteur
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Rogue sub-class for 5E that helps you become an infiltrator of organizations and agent of change. Whether it is running a heist, taking down a corrupt government, or starting a rebellion, the Saboteur gives you the tools you need to take down whatever edifice your enemy is hiding behind.

boardgame.name: Combat Tables
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement to the 1979 Game Master’s Guide – as originally authored by E. Gary Gygax and the worthy sages of TSR – provides several decades’ worth of comprehensive improvements, expansions, errata, clarifications, rulings, and interpretive aids for the Advanced rules set of the world’s foremost Fantasy Role-Playing Game.

Supplementary notes, provided for particularly enterprising Game Masters, will also allow for conversion of concepts to the Essentials and 5th Edition rules sets.

boardgame.name: Teleporter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Super-Powered by M&M RPG release brings you Teleporter Enhanced Archetype. This ready-to-go character build provides a foundation for you to develop a super hero who uses teleportation to get around quickly and unpredictably. They may have also weaponized this ability. Gamemasters can also use the archetype as the basis for quickly building NPC heroes or villains off-the-cuff.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Synth Magazine 4
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Soundtrack for roleplaying that pairs old school art, gameable content, and swords-and-sorcery fiction with dungeon synth music.

Soundtrack:
Nameless Grave
Geisterbeschworer
Ris
Heaven

Art:
Eugene Jaworski

boardgame.name: Dungeon Synth Magazine 5
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Soundtrack for roleplaying that pairs old school art, gameable content, and swords-and-sorcery fiction with dungeon synth music.

Soundtrack:
Icewind Dale
Maal Dweb
Garadrak
Dunjon Magik

Art:
Eugene Jaworski

boardgame.name: Hack Attack Wooden Edition
boardgame.description:
With Hack Attack you will think again and again before placing a tile. A game with various strategies to connect or separate paths.

Depending on the role you get, your mission will be to connect or prevent the connection between the hacker computer and the internet. Will you be able to handle such a simple yet complicated task?

boardgame.name: Mork Borg - Soundtrack
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Commissioned by the designers of Mork Borg to accompany their RPG release, Gnoll composed this soundtrack melding dungeon-synth with grungy rock.

Includes art & text from the game and a cassette in matching Mork Borg yellow.

boardgame.name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth â Orie Box
boardgame.description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Orie - A deliberate counter-attacker, Orie can boost her attacks with strong defense, then seize the advantage to unleash a relentless assault.

Waldstein - Maximize Power! Waldstein's attacks do huge damage and have gigantic range. Watch out for disruption though!

Merkava - Merkava's unpredictable ranges and movement will disrupt foes' strategies and maximize the advantage of his flexible play style.

Wagner - Wagner utilizes powerful boosts to raise her stats and crush rivals. She intimidates foes to control their tempo and keep them on the back foot.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

boardgame.name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth â Seth Box
boardgame.description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Seth - Seth's mobile play style shifts rapidly between safe pokes and aggressive critical hits. Find the perfect moment to strike down your foe!

Enkidu - Break through your Prohibition and unleash true power! Enkidu gets stronger as he lands his critical attack, building into an unstoppable force.

Vatista - Control the battle with enhanced mobility and economy. Vatista compounds advantages until she's ready to unleash a massive strike and obliterate the opponent.

Nanase - Nanase's non-stop rapid fighting style will keep opponent's constantly on the defensive. Utilize mixups and counters to keep foes guessing.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

boardgame.name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth â Londrekia Solo Fighter
boardgame.description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

Londrekia's aggressive style holds the advantage while building up power for massive payoffs.

Not a complete game. Requires another Exceed Fighter to play.

boardgame.name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth â Yuzuriha Box
boardgame.description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Yuzuriha - Set up a flurry of powerful attacks and press your luck to unleash them on opponents with Yuzuriha's unique and unpredictable style.

Carmine - Carmine places traps throughout the arena which rise up and attack along with him!

Byakuya - Byakuya's opportunistic and aggressive play style keeps the pressure on opponents while setting traps around the area.

Mika - Mika doesn't have full control of her attacks, but her boosts give her the opportunity to adjust and rush down opponents as she fights.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

boardgame.name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth â Gordeau Box
boardgame.description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Gordeau - A debilitating fighter who drains the opponent then strikes when they are weak. Gordeau's well rounded attacks offer few openings to foes.

Chaos - Utilize superior tactics by placing your attacks anywhere in the arena to strike! There's nowhere to hide from Chaos's ever-present companion.

Hilda - A dedicated zoner who uses conjurations of shadow to keep her opponents at bay. Wear opponents down, or unleash huge attacks to obliterate them all at once.

Phonon - Raise the tempo with compounding power boosts that extend the range of your attacks! Phonon must choose carefully when to press the attack and when to gather strength.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

boardgame.name: Room 25: Hypercube
boardgame.description:
You are stuck in a maze like Prison. Escape this horrifying by trying to find Room 25, the rumored exit from this nightmare. But among your fellow inmates, may be Guardians, destined to entertain the sick game going on and end your sentence in the most gruesome way possible. You must escape this Maze.

Room 25 Hypercube is the latest installment of the Room 25 Game Series and will allow you to enter a New Dimension with the HYPERCUBE!

On their turn, players will plan their action to interract and move through the different rooms making up the maze like prison they are in. To win, they will have to escape alive by finding the Room 25 and its key at which point the game ends.

The Hypercube adds a new dimension to the game, now split into 3 levels.

boardgame.name: Tap It!
boardgame.description:
The electronic buzzer game Tap It! with 4 individual buzzers contains four ways to play.


Memo: works very similar to the MB game "Simon".
Tap It: quickly press the buzzer that shows your color
Switch: like Tap It, but with buzzers that light up at the same time and can change their color abruptly. Note: Tap It and Switch can be played with up to 8 players as the game probvides 8 different colors.
Pong: a table tennis simulation for 2 players.


—user summary

boardgame.name: Mascarade (second edition)
boardgame.description:
Who are you in Mascarade? Whoever you want to be...at least until someone else calls you out on it! Each character receives a face-down role card at the start of the game, and in a game with 4-5 players some role cards are placed in the center of the table. On a turn, you take one of three actions:

1) Announce your character: Claim the power of a certain character and take the associated action. You don't have to have that character card in front of you to take this action, but if someone else says that they're that character and reveals the card to prove it, that player takes the action instead while you lose one coin to the tribunal.

2) Swap cards or not: Take another player's character card along with yours, place them under the table, shuffle them around a bit, then give one card back to the other player while keeping one for yourself. You (presumably) know whether you changed characters and can have some idea of who you are now, but that other player might be in the dark.

3) Secretly look at your character: Look at your character card to make sure of who you are.

Play continues until one player obtains 13 coins and wins — or until a player has lost all of their coins, in which case the player with the most coins wins.

Mascarade includes more character cards than the number of players, so not all characters will be used in each game. The rules suggest that you use certain characters in your first games, but once you know the game, you can try many other distributions.

Note that this second edition of Mascarade includes 17 role cards, with these cards being a mix of roles from the original base game and the 2014 expansion.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere â please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. Itâs much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth â Hyde vs. Linne
boardgame.description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 2 fighters and everything you need to play:

Hyde - Hyde is a mobile, high-power fighter who can telegraph his attacks for huge power bonuses.
Linne - Linne's non-stop rushdown style seamlessly fuses boosts and attacks together to create custom strikes.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!

boardgame.name: Hand-to-Hand Wombat
boardgame.description:
To play Hand-to-Hand Wombat, you’re each given a secret identity as a Good Wombat or a Bad Wombat, then everyone closes their eyes. Good wombats build towers; Bad Wombats try to mess with those towers. After the timer is up, everyone opens their eyes and discusses, argues, and votes on who they think is a Bad Wombat.

Hand-To-Hand Wombat is like thumb wrestling combined with Mind Wrestling.


At the beginning of the game, you're given a role card : you'll either be a good Wombat or a bad Wombat
The game pieces are then scattered around the table.
Everyone closes their eyes while manipulating the pieces simultaneously. The Good Wombats are trying to build the three pyramidal towers in an orderly fashion whereas the Bad Wombats will try to cause chaos by deconstructing the towers or by ruining the pyramidal shapes.
When the timer runs out, everybody stops, open their eyes, discuss what just happened and votes to cast a player out of the game.
The Good Wombats win if they successfully build the towers before too many of their teammates have been eliminated. Otherwise the Bad Wombats win.


—Description from the Kickstarter page.

boardgame.name: Von Danzig nach Warschau
boardgame.description:
German war propaganda game to promote Stricker bicycles: A journey through Poland on the trail of the German army.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 in Danzig and have to reach Warschau at space 40. If a player gets on a red space, he wins a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Each red space represents a city or town which was taken by the "Deutsche Wehrmacht" in September of 1939. The text below the game board notes the dates of German victories and sometimes the number of Polish prisoners of war.

boardgame.name: Legendary Adventures: Epic Depths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doom Down Below!

Merlin summons the party to his tower for a dire task—find where important figures from across the globe have gone and free them from captivity. Of course once the adventurers discover what's really going on it's a whole lot bigger of a problem than some kingly kidnappings and missing empresses. Indeed the entire world will be affected by what the PCs learn about beneath the waves!

What's inside Epic Depths:

A subterranean and underwater adventure for characters of 21st level.
Statistics for the joristenz and porosi monsters, as well as the dreaded Marwolaeth.
Beautiful isometric cartography by Tommi Salama.
Pregenerated adventurers of 21st level for every class.

boardgame.name: Legendary Adventures: Epic 5E
Legendary Adventures: Epic Play for Fifth Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I've been designing books for D&D 5E since the release of the Fifth Edition System Reference Document (you can check them out here) and the urge for even bigger stories finally reared a couple years ago. Since then I've been playtesting epic games with berserkers able to fell fortresses with one momentous blow, druids transforming into the land itself, and wizards reworking magic in the most wondrous ways! Now I've got a 128 page sourcebook that provides everything you'll need to go beyond the core ruleset—or to fill up the GM's toolbox with a host of new epic creatures if you're already there.

Epic rules for every character class—attack with devastating swiftness, transform into the land itself, see magic in all its intricate glory, and much more
18 Epic Feats to choose from to customize your legendary adventurer. Transform one of your favorite magic items into a sentient creature, become resistant to types of damage, emulate the legendary resistance of monsters.
10 Epic Hazards including antimagic clouds, wild magic zones, planar bleeds, and other environmental anomalies to keep battles exciting as the threat of foes increases.
Over 50 monsters ranging from all-powerful gods of magic to the Four Harbingers of the Final Judgment, assassins from the future, and elementals formed from lava.


Epic Archetype Support
Among the more painful decisions when making this book was how to approach archetypes for epic play. One thing that makes legendary adventurers so deft is that you gain *more* than one archetype for your class—your assassin can also become an arcane trickster, or your evoker can learn to master divination! But what of making archetypes themselves epic? At 25th and 30th level legendary adventurers acquire additional prestige, and at the GM's discretion they can also (or alternatively) acquire epic features for every archetype from the 5E ruleset. These epic archetype features are not included in the core rulebook because this isn't intended to be a lengthy tome but all 19,000 words of them are available for free at www.epic5e.com!

boardgame.name: Red in Tooth and Claw
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The southern verge of the Sesve Forest is beset by evil. Woodsmen are slain, villagers’ flocks and herds are rended asunder, and no one seems able to stem the tide of evil. But this is no ordinary pack of wolves threatening the forest precincts; they strike with supernatural cunning, behave with human-like strategy, and show a pure evil unknown to nature.

You and your comanions must explore the southern edge of the forest and root out this pack of evil beasts before they strike again, and bring peace once more to the region. This adventure is the second in a trilogy of adventure modules, but can easily be played as a stand-alone module.

boardgame.name: Princess Luminace's Guide to the Pony Pantheon Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Studying the habits, origins, and potential futures of my fellow divine beings has lead me to better understanding of the universe itself! To be unbiased, I have included a study of my own divinity and some interesting test cases surrounding myself.
Table of contents:


Detailed divine portfolios of the pony pantheon.
In-depth analysis of two species created with the help of divine providence.
Numerous incantations and techniques worthy of further study.
Catalogs of esoteric and unusual methods of approaching standard methodologies.
Distinguishing traits and feats unearthed from across Everglow
Musings into the nature of divinity itself and our part in it.

boardgame.name: Shallots
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before the oceans drank Atlantis, they first drank deep of Askelion.

O! Fabled Askelion, blighted demesne of sorceror-thanes and the moon-touched, that eldritched fastness of profane ritual and sinister hedonism beneath the flickering emerald tint of a blighted aurora. Askelion, whose name was uttered with a dread whisper in the Long-Ago, before - mercy of mercies - her dim sun died or fled, and all the foul sorcerors and their fel servants were entomed as their Sphere became a blizzard-blown ball of ice.

Once a myriad, the flickering light of Nibiru waxes strongly enough to shift and rend that benighted glacier, exposing the highest eaves of one of Askelion’s accursed ziggurats. When that bale glow illuminates the storm-wracked sky, crews of the most damned bastards to have ever lived flock to Askelion like ravens after a kill, for safeguarded by curses, cold and whatever nefarious traps the sorceror-thanes set with their dying breaths lies a hoard of unimaginable wealth, including the legendary Crown of Thirteen Moons…

Shallots is #7 in a series of short hex- and dungeon-crawls for the PINKHACK system, but are easily adaptable to the OSR system of your choice. Each DOOMCRAWL is inspired by the iconic Special Herbs beat tracks by MF DOOM.

What's in this edition?

A 14-room dungeoncrawl in a frozen ziggurat!~
2d6 Rumors of what wonderous treasure can be found!
2d6 Encounters to terrify and imperil!
A steadily-thawing ice tomb, steadily flooding as the PCs explore...

boardgame.name: Arhcoon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These social raccoon folk stand short but live big. They are resourceful, social by nature, and are adept at both getting into and out of trouble. If you’re looking for a diminutive furry race to play with a variety of subraces based on where they were raised, look no further!

boardgame.name: Reveal
boardgame.description:
This fun and exciting trivia-style board game will put your knowledge to the test and provide hours of entertainment for the whole family. Reveal is a dynamic and engaging board game with a difference: there are no questions, only answers!

Reveal can be played as individuals or in teams and the object of the game is to guess the hidden movie, TV show and song titles to gain medals and walk the red carpet to be crowned Champion of the Titles.

The answer card is loaded into the Reveal card sleeve and then the card is pulled out to reveal only the first letter of each of the words in the title. The player then has two guesses, or 30 seconds, to correctly name the title and win three medals. An incorrect guess will result in the second letter of each of the title words being revealed but the quicker the title is guessed the more medals that are won! Once a player has scooped 15 medals it is time to head for the winner’s square at the centre of the board via any of the Red Carpet routes. In order to be crowned the ultimate Champion of the Titles a player must solve one final title from a category chosen by an opponent!

boardgame.name: The Secret Opera House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No one really knows where this location is - it could be in a cave, under a church or beneath a tomb...


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.
