Contents: A 20 x 60 map depicting a secret opera house and theatre, with a harem and den of pleasure. A decadent and indulgent location, hidden except to those that need to know...

Includes a chairless version, making the large room a hall.

boardgame.name: Pod Race Course
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you have quick enough reflexes?


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50x100 battlemap depicting a twisting canyon, used as a race track for Pod Racing. Includes no-building version too to use as generic canyon / badlands map

boardgame.name: The Cave of Wonders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Only a Diamond in the Rough can reach the treasure within...


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multi level battlemap set, with a choice of four different 30x30 entrances and a large 20x60 cave.

The map set depicts the Cave of Wonders from the story of Aladdin, with a huge Tiger-head entrance (with desert, haunted swamp, lava and tropical beach versions).

boardgame.name: The City of Shawarie - Rooftop Chase
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The guards are coming - run!


The City of Shawarie is a printable battemap compatible with any RPG game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The City of Shawarie is a day & night set, comprising of 2 30x60 battlemaps. The map depicts a desert Arabian-style city, with a maze of streets and rooftops. Provided in day and night versions

boardgame.name: Allies & Adversaries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

And we're back!!! All that good fisticuffs from the former days. In these action packed pages you'll find First Level and Monster versions of Fireball, Spider Queen, Ameoba, Terry the Torch, Raven, Purple Tigress, Radar, and Warlock. You'll also get two additional Monster stats for the Superior Sliithak and the Gingerbread Monster.

boardgame.name: CittÃ -Stato: Expansion
boardgame.description: The Expansion introduces two new Cities (Gaeta and Noli), 15 new powerful cards, and the fifth player's contents. This allows the players to add variability to their games and to play also in 5 players.

boardgame.name: Bulette Time
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 3-4 short adventure made for D&D 5e.

What is killing Marga Huff’s prize goats? The adventurers must get down to earth and save the Bounding Goat Farm from disaster.

boardgame.name: In the Stars
boardgame.description:
In the Stars is a 1 to 6 player roll and draw constellation game. In the game, players will create two constellations (three in a solo game). In the turn, the active player will choose a blue die and roll it with the rest of the non-blue dice. Then, the active player chooses three dice to draw and creates a constellation. Other players will choose a type from the rest of the three other dice to draw and create their own constellation.

When a player completes their constellations, the game will end when the last player finishes their final turn. Players score points based on the constellations created, the number of alien visits, and wormholes discovered. The player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Echoes From Fomalhaut (Issue #09 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 56-page fanzine featuring adventures and GM-friendly campaign materials for Advanced old-school RPG rules, with cover art by Graphite Prime, and illustrations by Vincentas Saladis, Cameron Hawkey, Denis McCarthy, Stefan B. Poag, and the Dead Victorians. This issue contains...

Beyond the Gates of Sorrow: Shipwrecked on a northern archipelago seemingly devoid of habitation, you must explore your surroundings and find a way off these rocks... and could there be some profit in it as well? Wilderness and mini-dungeon module for 2nd to 4th level characters, 19+18 keyed locations.
The Twelve Kingdoms: Players’ guide to a northern region ruled over by several petty feudal estates, and surrounded by raging seas. This article describes the customs, lands, and gods of this war-torn land.
The Vaults of Volokarnos: Orcs have been spotted near an ancient burial complex housing the resting places of old patrician families, and a famous warlord. The masters of the nearby town want the orcs gone... and are willing to overlook a bit of discrete grave-robbing on the side. A B/X dungeon for 1st level characters, 52 keyed areas.
Arak Brannia: The island-republic and its surroundings: a two-page mini-setting!
Also... players’ hex maps of the Twelve Kingdoms!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Altrair's Hideout
boardgame.description:
From the designers blurb:

A nice inn, a warm fireplace and someone to bet your precious coins, what could be better to start an adventure that this ?
I offer you Altrair's hideout, a quest filled with puzzles and tricks, deceptions and big rewards... maybe ?

boardgame.name: CCC-CNE-01 The Treasure Beneath
boardgame.description:
A mysterious location has been uncovered and a group of adventurers are tasked with charting a ship onto the Moonsea. There they begin their underwater quest to find the treasures of the Lost City of Northkeep, facing an assortment of deep-sea challenges and enemies and eventually meeting with an ancient clan of Orcs guarding the isolated ruins of Northkeep.

A 4-Hour Adventure for 5-10th Level Characters.

Premiered at the Canadian National Exhibition (CNE) 2018 in Toronto, ON CA.

—Publisher blurb
boardgame.rpgseries: The Shadows of the Northkeep Trilogy

boardgame.name: Dead Man's Chess
boardgame.description:
In Dead Man's Chess, 2-4 players can battle individually, or as teams, to conquer their opponents. Magic, specialty powers unique to your faction, and the ability to defend against incoming attacks are only a few of the powerful mechanics that augment the classic title into something completely different and exciting; Dead Man's Chess! 30+ unique factions exist in the game so far with more to come!

Players on their turn will roll a D6 to see if they can draw a boost card (attaches to a figure and changes how it moves or plays), Draw an Epic Card (these are powerful game-changing events), or in some cases use their factions ability. Regardless of what they do they move to the Battlefield phase where they draw a card that will allow them to move up to 2 pieces if not more plus they also can make a normal move with any piece. All figures move just like normal chess figures would but that is the only tie to Chess. Don't fear getting your King into the battle as they are your most powerful fighter and can devastate the foe and losing it doesn't lose you the game.

Throw out any pre-conceptions you know about classic Chess, because new moves, accelerated gameplay, and the ability to defend against incoming attacks on each and every combat sets Dead Man's Chess far apart from its predecessor. Strategy is not enough; Luck is not enough… you will need both to win!

boardgame.name: Salvatoris
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mystery scenario for the HOSTILE RPG (and Cepheus Engine).

The PCs are on a routine supply run to an outlying research base on the edge of known space. When they reach their destination – something has happened to the scientists. Many base personnel have jellyfish-like creatures covering their faces and are comatose. Others are dead, but have no alien thing on their face.

What's going on? What will happen next? Should the players not solve the mystery - will the same fate befall them?

Welcome to LX410 - an unknown world with an unknown threat.

boardgame.name: CCC-CNE-02 Before the Hatch
boardgame.description:
The Ancient sunken city of Northkeep is filled with wild magic and and unknown dangers. Within this desolate place, a warlock experiments on wildlife to create the ultimate living weapon capable of destroying the entire Moonsea region. In order to save the world, adventurers must stop the experiments from completing.

—Publisher blurb
boardgame.rpgseries: The Shadows of the Northkeep Trilogy

boardgame.name: Psionics+
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally introduced to the Pathfinder RPG by Dreamscarred Press, psionics are a unique set of rules that combine an innovative and balanced point system with unconventional fantasy themes. This book contains over 90 pages of new content for the psionics rule system found in Ultimate Psionics.

Psionics+ includes:

3 new races: the symbiotic Dualists, the psychotoxic Kambian, and the bizarre Sha'ah Breathers.
3 new base classes: the Genesis, who can create an avatar similar to a summoner's eidolon or a spiritualist's phantom, the Skipper, a teleportative warrior, and the Warpmind, who can teleport her enemies rather than herself.
7 new prestige classes, including the Astral Fist and the Soulbuster.
A guide to building and running psionic campaigns, including 3 sample organizations with a sample member for each.
26 sample NPCs that could be dropped into any psionic campaign, plus a new psionic NPC class: the Gifted.
A helpful cheatsheet for the psionic rules system.
5 new archetypes, a dozen new feats, new psionic monsters, items, and much more!

boardgame.name: CCC-CNE-03 Into the Depths
boardgame.description:
Part 3 of the Shadows of Northkeep Trilogy

A Shadow of the long-destroyed city of Northkeep has been found deep below the Moonsea. Filled with wild magic and inhabited by strange creatures and people, a group of Warlocks work to bring a great evil into the world. In order to protect the Moonsea, the Warlocks must be stopped.

A 4-Hour Adventure for five 5th to 10th Level Characters

Premiered at the Canadian National Exhibition in August 2018 as Part of the Shadows of Northkeep Trilogy.

For Part 1, see CCC-CNE-01 The Treasures Beneath

For Part 2, see CCC-CNE-02 Before The Hatch

—Publisher blurb
boardgame.rpgseries: The Shadows of the Northkeep Trilogy

boardgame.name: A.T.O.M.
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SCIENCE!

Since the late 1960s, ATOM has been the primary supplier of advanced weapons and technology to various criminal and terrorist organizations across the world. It has proven impossible to eradicate the organization, as they are scattered far across the world and hide within so many tech-based companies and research facilities.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone recognizes, even when meeting them for the first time.

boardgame.name: Hazard: Storm!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A storm is a common, sometimes violent atmospheric disturbance often accompanied by wind, rain, snow, hail, sleet, or thunder and lightning. Storms can be found all over Earth, on Earthlike planets, and even planets that are not at all Earthlike. Jupiter’s Great Red Spot is essentially an immense storm that’s been raging for hundreds of years.

Storms can vary in their power and their effect on an adventuring party. Some may be a minor annoyance; others can be life-threatening. All have profound effects on the adventurers’ plans (and the Referee’s plot) and can change things, usually for the worse.

Hazard: Storm! offers the Referee a set of rules for running storms in hir game. This file is short, but packed with information on creating and running storms of many types, in different environments, along with a brief discussion of their creation in nature and their effect on the PCs.

Hazard: Storm! Watch the skies!

boardgame.name: Breathless
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An independent journalist with an explosive report of atrocities committed abroad needs the heroes’ help in getting the video into the hands of her news agency. The daoren thus find themselves additional pawns in a cat-and-mouse game played across the San Angeles Metro with federal authorities constantly nipping at their heels, leading to the possibility of a traitor in their midst. Will the lid be blown off of crimes committed, or will the report end up being squelched — along with the adventurers’ lives?

Breathless is a short cyberpunk adventure for New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America, which uses the Cepheus Engine (CE), Cepheus Deluxe (CD) and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules. Other 2D6 systems are easily adapted.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: CCC-GSP-MON01-01 Shadows of Despair
boardgame.description:
When a young maiden is lured into the woods by a shadowy creature, her father suspects something is amiss and pleads for the aid of benevolent adventures to solve the mystery.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

—Cover blurb

boardgame.name: Digital Map Bundle: Season 2 (Elemental Evil)
boardgame.description:
Play online? Like to print out large-scale maps for the enjoyment of your players? Want a little more than the low-resolution maps included in the adventures? If the question is yes to one or more of these questions, then this might be what you're looking for. Painstakingly hand-drawn and hand-scanned at a mind-twisting 600 dpi, these maps lend an old-school feel to your game. This bundle includes over 30 maps including, as an added bonus, two never-before-published maps for DDEX2-9 Eye of the Tempest—Deru's Mine!

Maps are included for:

DDEX2-1 City of Danger
DDEX2-2 Embers of Elmwood
DDEX2-3 The Drowned Tower
DDEX2-4 Mayhem in the Earthspur Mines
DDEX2-5 Flames of Kythorn
DDEX2-6 Breath of the Yellow Rose
DDEX2-7 Bounty in the Bog
DDEX2-8 Foulness Beneath Mulmaster
DDEX2-9 Eye of the Tempest
DDEX2-10 Cloaks and Shadows
DDEX2-11 Oubliette of Fort Iron
DDEX2-14 The Sword of Selfaril
DDEX2-15 Black Heart of Vengeance
DDEX2-16 Boltsmelter's Book

—Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Digital Map Bundle: Season 3 (Rage of Demons)
boardgame.description:
Play online? Like to print out large-scale maps for the enjoyment of your players? Want a little more than the low-resolution maps included in the adventures? If the question is yes to one or more of these questions, then this might be what you're looking for. Painstakingly hand-drawn and hand-scanned at a mind-twisting 600 dpi, these maps lend an old-school feel to your game. This bundle includes over 30 maps in both .jpg and .pdf format for DDEX3-1, DDEX3-2, DDEX3-3, DDEX3-4, DDEX3-8, DDEX3-9, DDEX3-10, DDEX3-11, DDEX3-13, DDEX3-14, DDEX3-16.

—Cover blurb

boardgame.name: Digital Map Bundle: Season 4 (Curse of Strahd)
boardgame.description:
Play online? Like to print out large-scale maps for the enjoyment of your players? Want a little more than the low-resolution maps included in the adventures? If the question is yes to one or more of these questions, then this might be what you're looking for. Painstakingly hand-drawn and hand-scanned at a mind-twisting 600 dpi, these maps lend an old-school feel to your game. This bundle includes over 38 maps in both .jpg and .pdf format for DDAL04-01, DDAL04-02, DDAL04-03, DDAL04-04, DDAL04-06, DDAL04-07, DDAL04-08, DDAL04-09, DDAL04-10, DDAL04-11, DDAL04-12, DDAL04-013, and DDAL04-014.

—Cover blurb

boardgame.name: Digital Map Bundle: Season 5 (Storm King's Thunder)
boardgame.description:
Play online? Like to print out large-scale maps for the enjoyment of your players? Want a little more than the low-resolution maps included in the adventures? If the question is yes to one or more of these questions, then this might be what you're looking for. Painstakingly hand-drawn and hand-scanned at a mind-twisting 600 dpi, these maps lend an old-school feel to your game. This bundle includes over 82 maps in both .jpg and .pdf format!

—Cover blurb

boardgame.name: InvocaciÃ³n Fronteras: Leyendas de la Torre
boardgame.description:
RPG mode expansion for InvocaciÃ³n Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

Sucubo (14 - Air): Refill another player's Spells or Supports with random discard cards. For each one you place, you gain Mana.
Acechador (17 - Fire): Defeat all cards in Summon that have 2 or less Supports.



One player is designated the Keeper for the entire game. The rest of the players must take a player sheet.

The guardian will handle all the Golem's card stacks, he can't swap the place cards but he can choose them.
The players are allies and fight against the Guardian, that is, either the Guardian or a player wins.

The guardian will tell a story using the cards available to him as a point of inspiration. At each stage of preparation the
Guardian tells the story and uses his cards to hinder all players, but they can resolve it with a roll of the dice.

The game ends after 6 rounds, the DM will judge the final result...

boardgame.name: Eberron Archetypes: Heroes of the Five Nations
boardgame.description:
Like the approaching footsteps of an old foe you could never quite defeat, echoes of the Last War resound through the streets of Sharn. If peace is to be more than a fleeting dream, the people of this shattered realm need heroes...

Designed for use with the Wayfinder's Guide to Eberron (prior to the November 2019 update), Eberron Archetypes: Heroes of the Five Nations presents new subraces, new subclasses, new feats, new spells and more for 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons games set in the City of Towers and beyond.

—Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stonesaga
boardgame.description:
Stonesaga is a cooperative, campaign style, survival crafting board game set in a unique, persistent world shaped by your choices. It is designed by Max Brooke (Star Wars: X-Wing 2nd Edition, Legend of the Five Rings RPG) with Luke Eddy (Star Wars: Legion).

Generational Storytelling
In Stonesaga, you unfold the epoch-spanning story of the people of a remote glacial valley, guiding multiple generations of characters who make a life there amidst harsh conditions, wondrous mysteries, and giant monsters.

Each game session covers one generation of people within a society, continuing from the last and permanently changing the valley in various ways based on in-game events and the players’ decisions.

Cooperative Survival
Stonesaga follows a certain rhythm: faced by a new opportunity or crisis, the people of the valley must meet their society’s new needs. Meanwhile, the valley’s other inhabitants – immortal beasts – will seek to fulfill their own needs as their instincts dictate. You will have to navigate both sets of challenges, using might, dexterity, conviction, and awareness to survive as a tribe in the wild.

Crafting & Building
Stonesaga introduces a completely new discovery based crafting mechanic. Do you think that a sharpened stone and stick could combine to create a spear? Use the crafting action and find out. You will need to discover the properties of various crafting materials as you expand your crafting “recipe” knowledge.

Work together as a community to build your village together. From a simple fire pit and tent to a forge and library, create a civilization that lasts the generations.

Exploration & Discovery
Stonesaga rewards exploration and chooses to let you experience the world in a unique way each play session. Working on the established rules of the world, you will discover unique materials, monsters, and areas of the world that you won’t be directed towards. Stonesaga lets the curious and inquisitive thrive.

Persistence
Designed for drop-in, drop-out play and flexible playgroup availability, Stonesaga can be played by one group from start to finish, played with a rotating cast, or even passed between groups seamlessly. Components are sometimes permanently altered, but never removed or discarded entirely.

boardgame.name: Seaside Salvage: Eberron Salvage Mission Anthology
boardgame.description:
Visions, vanishings, and vacation fever are plaguing the residents of Salvation Outpost. In the ruins of the town of Seaside along Kraken Bay... treasures and terrors await.

SEASIDE SALVAGE is an anthology of five Tier 2 salvage missions that can be used as part of the Oracle of War alternate campaign for D&D Adventurers League organized play. These adventures are set in and around the ruins of Seaside, a harbor town along the coasts of the Mournland in the world of Eberron. Each four-hour adventure is designed for characters of 5th to 10th level (optimized for 8th-level characters).

Big Trouble in Little Seaside. After witnessing a procession of apparitions, the characters are caught between rival gangs fighting for control of Seaside.

The Light Keeper. The spirit of a fallen kalashtar is fused to a lighthouse, creating a powerful psionic beacon that lures unsuspecting victims to their doom.

Murder in the Hot Springs. A sulfurous hot spring resort becomes the site of a string of disappearances, and adventurers are hired to investigate.

Queen Mishann’s Revenge. When Salvation appears to be flooded, the heroes must defend their base from a vengeful ghost ship and its crew.

A Race to the Sea. An ambitious member of House Orien has been transformed into a sahuagin baron and holds grand races through a valley of death.

This product contains:


57 pages of original adventure content



Hyperlinks to publicly available monster stat blocks



An appendix with stat blocks for other AL-legal monsters



A separate printer-friendly document (US letter size)


—Publisher blurb

boardgame.name: Season 5 Narrative: Parnast, Stagwick, & Beregost
boardgame.description:
Want a bit of insight into the design process for the D&D Adventurers League? Using Parnast, Stagwick, or Beregost in a home game and want a bit of background information? Then this is for you! Inside, you'll find the narrative used by the Campaign Administrators in developing the Season's storyline as well as:

- A brief history of the cities
- A number of the major organizations within the cities and their prominent NPCs
- Featured locations inside and around the cities itself

These provide a behind-the-scenes look at the materials presented to designers and include material that wasn't utilized in the adventures released through the Season.

Enjoy!

—Publisher blurb

boardgame.name: Galactic Magic
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Book

UNLEASH COSMIC POWER!
Unravel the eldritch mysteries of the galaxy with Starfinder Galactic Magic! This book demystifies Starfinder’s magical possibilities, providing your characters fantastic abilities to overcome any challenge. Whether you master the secrets of arcane academies, steal spells with supernatural finesse, or draw power from the gods themselves, Galactic Magic redefines what you thought possible with:

The new precog character class, who can bend time to her will and outwit foes with combat predictions!
Exciting ways to channel magical might, with reality-warping rituals and over 100 new spells!
New player options, from magical variants for every character class to legendary artifacts and magic items.
Discoveries about the galaxy’s most powerful mystical forces, from alignment singularities and metastars to deities and the boons they offer!
A study of eldritch secrets and everyday arcana alike, including how a magic user navigates society and the organizations that might support and oppose them.

boardgame.name: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night Land
boardgame.description:
There's a lost dog in the Mournland and its owner is paying good coin to retrieve it. Easy job easy pay, right?

Zodor Tarev has asked you to find a dog, no questions asked. But when the dog appears to be more than just a mere mutt, can the salvagers bring it to heel and escort it back to its owner?

A 3-4 hour Tier 2 Salvage Mission optimized for 5 characters APL 8 and is legal to use with the Oracle of War Campaign under the rules in Eberron: Oracle of War: Salvage Bases and Missions.

Includes 3 map images for use with online games.

—Publisher blurb

boardgame.name: Trust No One
boardgame.description:
House Tarkanan and the Trust have embroiled the Sharn underworld in a silent war, the result of which has dire consequences for Zilargo. The characters must fight their way through assassins, aberrant dragonmarks, information brokers, and fancy parties in this conflict between shadow organizations.

An Eberron adventure for 1st to 4th level characters

Keith Baker (creator of the Eberron setting and Wayfinder's Guide to Eberron), Wayne Chang (co-host of Manifest Zone), and Anthony Turco (creator of the Korranberg Chronicle series) return to Sharn to present part 2 of the Fear Reveals Truth adventure path!

Download part 1, Curtain Call: A Sharn Adventure, on DMs Guild today!

boardgame.name: Cat Detective
boardgame.description:
Cat Detective is a cooperative deduction game for 2 to 5 players.

In the game, players are children who are blamed for a shattered vase. The goal is to find out the cat broke the vase, where is the other half, how, and when, plus the accomplice cat. In their turn, players will collect cards from others to create sets and eliminate possible crime elements. When a number of sets are created, the game ends, and players will write their conclusions on the report.

If the four main crime elements are discovered, players win the game. If fails, they will be grounded for at least two weeks.

The game is paw. Are you ready to solve the meow-stery?

boardgame.name: Empire's End
boardgame.description:
You lead a grand civilization at the height of its influence, but can you save it from collapse? In Empire's End, 2-4 players compete to keep calamity at bay. Empire's End marries the intuitive and elegant mechanism of reverse-bidding with engine-building, long-term planning, and strategic depth. The result is a game with a quick tempo, abundant tension, and multiple challenging paths to victory.

Players begin with a civilization at the height of its power. Play proceeds through a series of phases, varying as you progress through the game. During the Disaster phase, players face a common threat such as famine, a flood, or barbarians. The player who ends the bidding must take the disaster, which devastates one of their territories.

With each disaster that befalls an empire, its people grow in wisdom and resilience. In the style of the modern classic game No Thanks, resources bid by all players will end up in the hands of the player who ultimately takes the disaster card. That player also gains a new ability, an innovation that reflects their empire's ability to adapt in the face of challenging times.

Each turn, players move along a progress track that dictates whether they will face a disaster or another type of phase. Players can gain new resources during Production phases, rebuild lost territories during Industry phases, and challenge one another during Military phases. At the end of the progress track, the game is concluded and the winner is the civilization with the greatest number of victory points. Intact territories contribute points, but innovations and military successes can provide alternative ways to win.

boardgame.name: Table Golf Association
boardgame.description:
The Table Golf Association (TGA) is the first dexterity game that allows you to design and play your own golf course.

Using 25 two-sided wooden terrain tiles, you decide the layout of the course, and make it as easy or difficult as you choose. The game comes with a Tee Box and several different "holes". You complete the course by adding tiles that include roughs, sand hazards, trees, water hazards, and a cliff, as well as the fairway tiles. The game includes four balls that are basically mini-shuffleboard pieces that you must flick from tee box to hole, while trying to avoid the hazards just like in real golf.

If you do hit into the hazards, each one carries its own unique mechanism to replicate the challenges of real golf. For example, hitting into the sand means you must hit your next shot using the thumb of your non-dominant hand. Each hazard also limits the distance you can hit your next shot.

The game also includes a weather die and spinner that must be rolled before each shot to determine the wind speed and direction. Golf pro player cards, which players can choose or deal out randomly, each have a different ability players can use once per hole.

Whoever has the lowest score after the final hole wins.

TGA can be played solo, one-on-one, in teams, or as a league.

boardgame.name: Culann's Hound
boardgame.description:
Before chess, there were the ancient Tafl games of the Nordic & Celtic people. Rooted in the same idea of military strategy, but with a less complicated rule set.

Due to the less than stellar documentation of these games, there's a number of ways to setup the board, and approach your strategy, but the basics are always the same. Two teams, a king and his guards, and twice as many attackers, on a checkered board, take turns moving their pawns across the board, surrounding one another to remove them from the board. If the king escapes to the edge of the board, the guards win, if the king is captured, the attackers win.

boardgame.name: The Oregon Trail: Go West, Young Pioneer! (Books 1-4 Box Set)
boardgame.description:
In this boxed set, choose your own trail and complete the journey to Oregon City with all four paperbacks in this exciting series! It's 1850 and your first goal is to get your family, covered wagon full of supplies, and oxen to Chimney Rock on time. But hurry -- you'll need to make it through the rugged mountains before winter snow hits. Plus, there are wild animals, natural disasters, unpredictable weather, fast-flowing rivers, strangers, and sickness that will be sure to stand between you and your destination!

Which path will get you safely across the unforgiving terrain -- from Independence, Missouri to Oregon City? With twenty-two possible endings in each book, choose wrong and you'll never make it on time. Choose right and blaze a trail that gets you closer to your final destination -- and don't forget to look at your map!

The box includes:
1. The Race to Chimney Rock
2. Danger at the Haunted Gate
3. The Search for Snake River
4. The Road to Oregon City

+ A full-color poster of the Oregon Trail!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Oregon Trail: Be A Trailblazer! (Books 5-8 Box Set)
boardgame.description:
This paperback box set includes four Oregon Trail adventures where you choose the path to Oregon City, plus more than five colorful decals. Featuring 8-bit black-and-white illustrations throughout, each book is its own unique journey west with more than twenty possible endings!

Ford rivers, hike mountains, and trek the Oregon Trail, young pioneer! On your way, you’ll face wild animals, natural disasters, famine, sickness, unpredictable weather, and more. You’ll also meet helpful strangers and encounter dishonest people—who will you choose to trust? With more than twenty possible endings in each standalone book, each decision counts. Make the right choices and blaze a trail out west!

This box includes:
5. Alone in the Wild
6. Wagon Train Trek
7. Gold Rush!
8. Calamity in the Cold

+ Colorful decals/stickers featuring 8-bit art

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Oregon Trail: Hit The Trail! (Books 1 & 2 Combo)
boardgame.description:
Go west, young pioneer — your journey begins here! Inside you’ll find two books in one: The Race to Chimney Rock and Danger at the Haunted Gate. In these first two legs of your trek on the Oregon Trail, you need to find your way to prominent landmarks Chimney Rock and Devil’s Gate — but not without unpredictable challenges ahead. Natural disasters, disease, and dishonest people are challenges you’ll face in the wild frontier. Make the right choices and make it halfway to your final destination in Oregon Territory!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Oregon Trail: Oregon City Or Bust! (Books 3 & 4 Combo)
boardgame.description:
Explore the frontier, young pioneer! Inside, find two choose your own trail books in one: The Search for Snake River and The Road to Oregon City. In these last two legs of your trek on the Oregon Trail, you’re halfway to Oregon City, but do you have the grit to make it there? The wild frontier is full of risks and surprises! Continue your journey west and reach your final destination — if you can make the right decisions!

-- publisher's description
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: The Oregon Trail: Trail Guide
boardgame.description: A poster-sized map of the Oregon Trail route, with 8-bit-style artwork. Included in the softcover version of the Books 1-4 box set.
boardgame.rpg: The Oregon Trail: Choose Your Own Trail

boardgame.name: Remedial Chaos Theory
boardgame.description:
Old school game play, with a new school twist. Roll the die, leave your home 'timeline portal' and work your way around the board collecting tokens from each of the others. When you get them all, take them to the 'prime timeline portal' and win the game.

Sounds easy right? Well, with a non-linear board, figuring out your best move with each roll gets a bit more complicated. And once you're in a portal, you need the luck of the die to get back out.

Still too easy? Play it as the 'darkest timeline' and any other players can steal your tokens at any time, sending you back home to start over. Fun thing is, you can do the same to them.

boardgame.name: Murder of a Millionaire
boardgame.description:
A murder has been committed in Redmond, a small town just south of London, UK. The body of Chloe Whittle, a millionaire lottery winner, was found late at night in a local park, with a fatal stab wound to the chest. We’ve identified several suspects and assembled this case file of evidence, including photographs, maps, text chains, police reports and more. As the town’s leading detective, we’re relying on you to uncover the truth behind Chloe’s demise.

We need you to analyse and cross-reference the evidence found within the case folder. Your mission is simple: Eliminate as many of the suspects as possible, so that we can find the killer (or killers) and bring them to justice. In addition to the evidence found here, you will also be required to access the internet to uncover further clues to help you solve this puzzling investigation.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Components: Digital Hybrid â App/Website Required

boardgame.name: Baby Ninjas
boardgame.description: Baby Ninjas is a card game of “Hot POOtato.” Players start with a mystery envelope holding either a clean or a dirty baby ninja token. Action cards are used to figure out which baby ninjas are where, move or swap babies around, and make sure someone else who is not you gets stuck with diaper doody at the end of the round.

boardgame.name: Behind the Five Seals
boardgame.description:
The Mysterious Tower of Magic was left without a master. Now the wizards of the Great Five will have to choose a new master.

The Shaman of the North, the Witch of the East, the Sorcerer of the South, the Seer of the West and the Sorcerer of Outland will leave their regalia and books, amulets and artifacts in the main hall of the Tower. They will go to meet the trials, armed only with their talents, will, knowledge, and with the help of faithful familiars - magical animals. Descending into the dungeons of the tower, players find themselves in the very center of the labyrinth. All possible routes diverge from it, and the most distant rooms contain spell scrolls, only all passages are protected by magical seals of the four elements.

The search takes place in rounds, at the beginning of each of which the players, in turn, take three different-colored dice from the general supply and roll them. Sinces the mage can easily move from one point of the dungeons to another, if there is no obstacle in his way, it is very important not to give rivals a chance to steal the scroll from under your nose. To do this, you need to skillfully occupy strategically important passages with the chips of your mage and familiar. The collected scrolls not only bring victory points, but also allow you to manipulate dice, seal tokens lying on the playing field, and even the enemy.

The game end when a rounds ends with the number of scrolls with a strength of 6 is checked (at least 3 for 2-3 players or at least 4 for 4-5 players).

The winner is the player with the most victory points (the sum of all his scrolls and bonus points for spells).

There was room for five circles of magic in the box, and only two of them (one basic and one additional set of scrolls) are used in each batch. Each circle of magic has its own specialization, so their choice affects the nature of what is happening in the dungeons of the tower. This allows you to diversify the game and provides high replayability.

boardgame.name: Game of Jack and the Beanstalk
The Game of Jack and the Beanstalk
boardgame.description:
A dual race game. the giant must race up a staircase, reaching step 40, before Jack reaches the bottom leaf of the beanstalk (#20).

Each player moves by rolling dice. Jack rolls one die. The giant, being bigger, rolls 2 dice.

Rules pasted on inside of box cover.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Jack and the Beanstalk

boardgame.name: SWAT Siege
boardgame.description:
(from the back cover of the game)

SWAT Siege takes you to the heart of the action with its wide number of missions. Can you neutralize the different group of enemies?

boardgame.name: Raindrops
boardgame.description:
Raindrops is a game about having fun in the rain.

Every round, players simultaneously choose and play a card from their randomised starting hands. Each card has a specified number of raindrops to be placed on them. The highest unique number (as well as highest unique yellow number) gets to collect raindrops from cards already played, and the lowest unique number receives one raindrop from the bank.

Play cards wisely as same numbers cancel each other out! From the fifth round onwards, raindrops on previously played cards start to evaporate. The player who has collected the most raindrops after 11 rounds wins.

Players can try having the same starting hand for a more competitive variant.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Crocodile River
boardgame.description:
You find yourself in the middle of a raging river in the jungle with crocodiles everywhere. Luckily there are rocks in the river on which you can step. Use numbered cards to move pawns advancing yours or blocking your opponents.

Can you escape the crocodiles and reach the shore first?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Henry Stickmin Collection
boardgame.description:
A choose-your-own-path where failing is more fun than succeeding.

The Henry Stickmin Collection is a Newgrounds choose-your-own-path classic, reborn and revitalized. This 6-game epic culminates in multiple entirely canon, extremely different endings. Each step of the journey has you choose from options such as a Teleporter or calling in your buddy Charles to help you out. Correct choices will move the story forward, but incorrect choices lead to a fail. If you get to the end on your first try, you’re doing it wrong.

Source: The Publisher Website.


User summary

A revamp and collection of six previously published browser games as well as a new part made only for this collection.

boardgame.name: Retrowave
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





User Summary

Drive the endless neon highways in 10 different 1980s super cars with synthwave pumping out of the speakers.

Along the way you can upgrade and change your car as you glide through the games various universes in it's four different game modes.

boardgame.name: 80' - The Eightieth Minute
boardgame.description:
from itch.io

Experience the last minutes of the last match of a grueling soccer campaign, the glory or the heartbreak of an all-or-nothing result. Ten minutes plus stoppage time remain. All still to play for.

It is the 80th minute . . .

boardgame.name: Midnight Protocol
boardgame.description:
A tactical narrative-driven RPG in a digital future. Hack into servers, beat security and steal encrypted data in a world where your identity is just another network address.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: A Greeblin's Journey
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A Greeblin’s Journey is a solo journaling game about a traveling creature called a Greeblin. They have become unsettled from their home and are now traveling for the first time in a world they have never explored. The road is strange and not nearly as kind as their bed, but they had to do something. They had to go somewhere.

boardgame.name: Alone Among Their Dreams
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Alone Among Their Dreams is a small solo TTRPG about entering into strange realities contained within hazy spheres. It's based on Takuma Okada's "Alone Among the Stars", and is intended to emulate various surrealist works, such as Alice in Wonderland. Uses a standard 52 card deck and a six-sided die.

boardgame.name: Alone on a Map
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You are a renown cartographer that has been tasked with creating a comprehensive map of the entire world. To do this you have divided the world into 36 quadrants and will label the most important Landmarks.


Alone on a Map solo tabletop role playing game about discovering landmarks and creating a map.

This game uses a standard deck of playing cards, 2 six-sided dice, writing implements, a grid, and an optional coin.

boardgame.name: A Long Walk Home
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A business card sized RPG about finding home. Generate a map over any flat surface with a handful of six-sided dice and journal about your travels across this new world.

This game requires the rules printed in standard business card size, a handful of D6s, some paper and a pencil, and a large flat surface. You will also need time and patience. Finding home is no easy task.

boardgame.name: Alice in Wordland: Curiouser & Curiouser
boardgame.description:
New guests arrive at the tea party bringing even more joy and chaos.
Players need to follow even madder rules and things are getting curiouser and curiouser!

Curiouser & Curiouser expansion introduces 4 new characters (the King of Hearts, the March Hare, the Duchess and the Jabberwock) and a new Event mechanic with quirky happenings every round affecting scoring and the character abilities. A mini game might even be added!

Every round, players change their character and a new Event is drawn, changing either the rules or the scoring of the round. Then, according to the rules of the base game, three Forbidden Letters and a Discussion theme are drawn. The player to the left of the Queen of Hearts presses the teapot to start the timer and the game begins.
Each player has to say a word, suitable to the Discussion theme while avoiding the Forbidden Letters before the time runs out. If they successfully do so, they reset the timer and the next player has to give their own word. If someone doesn't say a suitable word in time they are out for the round and when only one player remains the round ends. The longer each player stays in a round, the more points they are awarded.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Out of Puberty: Chapter 1
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Young and Beautiful Pearl, finished her school and has decided to move out of her Parents safety, into her own place. Well not really her own. Her Uncle owns multiple Houses and Apartments and offered Pearl to stay in one of them, for a Price, a Beautiful young women like Pearl can afford, or so she thinks.

Meet different characters all having a part in Pearl's life and find out how they will affect her. Be part of her day to day struggles and enjoy a story full of corruption, love, friendship and LUST!

A Story for those who enjoy coming of age story's and red heads

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Last Enchantress: Revival
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





This is a choice-based fantasy game in which we play the role of Lora, a young enchantress who lives in a place called the "Tower". The girl plans to go through the Revenir ritual and become the youngest Adept in the history of the Tower, but... destiny has other plans. Lora's life is in your hands. You decide where Lora will go and who she will become. Good or Evil – it's only your choice.

Together with Lora, you will embark on a grand journey through the vast and expansive world of TLE. Witness the beauty of ancient kingdoms, small cosy villages and big cities.

Meet a diverse cast of characters with unique personalities and backgrounds and form meaningful relationships with them that will evolve throughout the game. Perhaps you will even find your true love.

The game features several dynamic game mechanics. Unlock codex entries as you meet various characters to learn more about their personalities and their past. Find old books and ancient scrolls to learn more about the world of TLE. Follow up on your journey, on your choices and their consequences by reading Lora’s diary.

Wreak havoc on your enemies. The turn-based battle system will allow you to use the spells of different schools of magic you learn during the game to defeat your foes and heal your allies. Choose your strategy wisely, and no one will be able to stand against you.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: 3D Waifu
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





This is a waifu fuck simulator game! Have sex with your bff!

Game content:

You can get her wet and in extase with several playtoys! Give her first bang experience an extraordinary touch!

boardgame.name: UNLOCK: The guessing game
boardgame.description:
In UNLOCK, 1 to 6 players compete to unlock the hidden smartphone-unlocking code created by another player called ‘The Lock’ by a series of attempts. The lock player will give players information about how close they are to the hidden code on each attempt. When at least one of the players finds the secret code, the one that did best in the unlocking attempts will win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Syncron
boardgame.description:
Syncron is a quick card game for 4 to 10 players. In Syncron, all players play their cards simultaneously, aiming to move their meeples forward in order to win the race. But in Syncron, a wide variety of skills can be used to win the game, apart from just intelligence. You’ll need empathy, intuition, prescience, negotiation skills and even mind-reading powers.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Book of Wondrous Magic Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Surprise and delight your players with these new magic items for the world's greatest roleplaying game!

The Book of Wondrous Magic contains one hundred more of the most imaginative and useful magic items ever devised! Each one has been carefully balanced so you can use it in your game right away. The perfect way to liven up any treasure hoard and an essential resource for every Fifth Edition game.

boardgame.name: Operation Wallace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Race Against Time Versus the Enemy Within!

At the height of the Blitz, mysterious coded radio messages are drifting across London’s airwaves, and Section M’s analysts at Clemens Park want to know why.

With no front-line troops readily available, a group of more academically-minded agents are drafted in to investigate. The signals are traced to an anonymous North London terraced house and a daring raid reveals the presence of an ancient anti-monarchical cult, who are using the confusion of the Luftwaffe’s nightly bombing raids to further their own dark agenda.

So begins a desperate race against time, as Section M’s studious operatives trace radio signals to their source, employ code and cipher breaking, and embark on a desperate chase across London to piece together the evidence, which leads to the terrifying discovery that the cult intend to conduct eldritch rites in the capital itself.

As the Luftwaffe’s bombs start to rain down during another night raid, can the agents find the rite’s location, foil the plans of this sinister cult, and prevent the return of a native horror which has lain dormant down the ages?

Features

Operation Wallace is a 29-page PDF adventure for 4-6 players in both standard and printer-friendly formats. It can be run as one-off adventure or easily incorporated into an ongoing campaign
Comprises a thrilling domestic adventure made for less combat-oriented agents
Explore the mysteries of London during the height of the Blitz
Battle the malevolent order of Saint Cailtram and face an ancient horror from the long dark

boardgame.name: LOQ
boardgame.description:
Welcome to LOQ, the game of deft descriptions and express guesswork!

On your turn, you draw a card and try to describe as many words and phrases as possible before your time runs out; your teammates try to guess the words. The team scores points for each word guessed correctly. There’s a twist, though: in each round, you have to describe or guess the words in a particular way. For example, sometimes the describer can use just 3 words; sometimes their teammates can make just 1 guess! Each of the 10 rounds presents a fresh challenge.

There are 5 categories of word to describe: people and places, adjectives(descriptions), nouns (things and ideas) ,verbs(actions), and phrases. The words can be described in any order. However, in each round there is a key word worth 1 extra point, so it’s often best to start with this.

You can play LOQ in 2 ways:
Cooperatively; with everyone together against the game, or
Competitively; with teams of two or more players competing against each other. It’s a lot of fun either way!

The game ends after 10 rounds and lasts about 10 minutes per team. In competitive games, the team with most points wins. If you are playing a cooperative game, check your score against the ratings card for the difficulty level you played at. Was your performance Excellent or just Ordinary?

DIFFICULTY LEVELS
There are a staggering 6000 words and phrases to describe and guess! These are divided into four levels of difficulty:
Level 1 (yellow)
Level 2 (green)
Level 3 (red)
Level 4 (blue)

boardgame.name: The Border
boardgame.description:
Your goal in The Border is to surround as many areas as possible as quickly as you can.

Each player has an erasable game board that features nine areas, with each area being surrounded by a path of hexagons and with these hexagons being grouped in six colors. Most of these paths border two areas. Two hexagons are white and contain an X mark.

On your turn, you roll five dice up to three times, keeping and re-rolling dice as you wish. Each die has a different color on each of its six sides. Once you stop, you can use the die results to X spaces on your game board, but only if you can X off all the spaces in that group. If you roll four orange and one red, for example, you can X off a group of two, three, or four orange hexagons, but not a group of five orange hexagons since you have only four orange on the dice.

After you take your turn, each other player can X off one space on their game board for each die that you didn't use on your turn — but only if those spaces are adjacent to ones that are already Xed. If you marked off a group of three orange hexes, for example, then each opponent could mark off one orange and one red, assuming they are adjacent to previously marked spaces.

When you mark off the final hex that borders an area, you score that area, earning 4-12 points depending on its size. Any other player who surrounds that area on a later turn receives only half as many points.

As soon as a player completes their sixth area, you finish that turn, then everyone sums their points to see who wins.

boardgame.name: Exacto
boardgame.description:
Can you figure out which two cards match? The combination will differ each time you play!

Exacto contains 15 large, thick cards, each having a pair of holes in it, along with eight colored circles on the front side.

To play, shuffle the deck, then lay out two cards, one face up with the colored circles visible and the other face down with only the holes visible. The first player looks at the cards — without touching them or using any tool other than their eyes — then names the two colored circles they think are the same distance from one another as the holes on the face-down card. They then take the face-down card and overlay it on the face-up card to see whether they're correct. The match will be perfect, and if they're correct, they keep the face-down card as a point and return the face-up card to the bottom of the deck; if they're wrong, the next player names two colors, etc.

The next round starts with the player to the left of whoever most recently won a point. When only one card remains in the deck, the game ends, and whoever collected the most cards wins. Alternatively, play until someone scores their third point.

21 Games from Microgamesia is made of 21 cards vividly illustrated front and back, cubes, disks, a die and the rulebook: everything you need to take the game with you anywhere, in any game environment.

Microgamesia offers games to suit every taste and every situation: strategic games for two players, exhilarating party games, challenging adventures... Microgamesia is perfect both for game nights with friends not too keen on games, and for gaming clubs with expert players. You don’t know what game to bring to your game night? With Microgamesia you don’t have to choose.
